intro: Cyrtandra propinqua, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. Cyrtandra propinqua has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
